div.l: Doun ran the blodi streem vpon the brest
And in the floor with nose ⁊and mouth to broke
They walwen as don ij pigges in a poke
And vp they gon and doun agein anon
Til that the Millere sporned at a ston
And doun he fill bacward vpon his wif
That wist no thing of this nice strif
For she was falle aslepe a litill wiȝt
With Iohn the clerk that waked had al niȝt
And with the fall out of hir slepe she breide
Helpe holi cros of Bromholm she seide
In manus tuas lord to the I calle
Awake Symkin the fende is on me falle
Myn hert is broken helpe I nam but ded
There lith on my wombe ⁊and on myn hed
Helpe Simkyn for the fals clerkes fiȝte
This Iohn sterte vp as fast as euer he miȝt
And grapeth bi the walles to and fro
To finde a staf and she stirt vp also
And knew the estres bet than did this Iohn
And bi the wall the staf she fonde anon̄
And sawȝ alitill skemeryng of a niȝt
For at an hole it shon the monebriȝt
And bi that liȝt she sauȝ hem bothe tuo
But sikerli she nist who was ho
But as she sauȝ a white thing in her yhe
And whan she gan this white thing espie
She wende the clerk had wered a volupere
And with that word she drouȝ ay nere and nere
And wend ha it this Alein at the fulle
And smot the Millere on the pilled sculle
Than doun he goth and cried harrow I dye
The clerkes bet him wel and let him lye
And ordeined hem and took her hors anon̄
And eke her mele and on her weye they gon
And at the mille yit thei took her cake
Of half a busshel flour ful wel I bake
Thus is the proude Millere wel I bete
And hath lost the grinding of his whete
And paide for the souper eueridel
Of Alein and of Iohn that bet him well
His wif is swifed and his douȝters als
